text: @DeTom48 @EnvAgencySE Fair enough thank you for explaining it to me, do you know if there are any future plans in the work to DE silt  the Thames anytime soon?
@EnvAgencySW Thank you for getting back to me. I will call the hotline.

@Charlie_Bil @EnvAgencySE De silting is only removing the soft silt on the river bed, dredging is removing soft silt along with river bed to create a bigger depth, which is harmful to a river structure
@NorthsideDan @EnvAgency @myworcester Such a shame about the swan

@EnvAgencySW
@oliver_hartland @EnvAgencyMids @coventrycc Thanks Oliver. Is there not a risk it’ll accelerate the flow downstream, causing challenges elsewhere in the channel?

@RusBrennan @EnvAgencyMids @coventrycc Hi Russ, it keeps the conveyance channel clear so that water can flow freely without obstruction therefore making full use of the channel capacity which helps to reduce flood risk

text: @EnvAgency I’ve been reporting this for 4 years. I have a list of incident numbers. The EA do nothing about it. I’m not the only one.

Apparently @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyAnglia need more reports of this. 
Mine is dated January 4th, Ref no 01875990
Observed 1pm 22/12/20 and again 2pm 4/1/21

This is a huge issue. Urgently needs addressing. Oil or diesel pouring into our beautiful Norfolk river. see map https://t.co/fwW8T2r7xv https://t.co/CW61pUaZTv
